briefTitle: Use of Dexmedetomidine to Reduce Emergence Delirium Incident in Children
officialTitle: Use of Dexmedetomidine for Emergence Delirium in Children Undergoing General Anesthesia for Endovascular Interventional Neuroradiologic Procedures
summary: Emergence delirium (ED) from general anesthesia posts risk and harm to pediatric population undergo general anesthesia. The purpose of the study is to compare the use of dexmedetomidine versus placebo in reducing the incidence and severity of ED in a pediatric neurosurgical population.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With Emergence Delirium
